documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: Ansible security and bug fix update (2.9.4)

note.text:
An update for ansible is now available for Ansible Engine 2.9

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which
gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from
the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
Ansible is a simple model-driven configuration management, multi-node
deployment, and remote-task execution system. Ansible works over SSH and
does not require any software or daemons to be installed on remote nodes.
Extension modules can be written in any language and are transferred to
managed machines automatically.

The following packages have been upgraded to a newer upstream version:
ansible (2.9.4)

Bug Fix(es):
* CVE-2019-14904 Ansible: vulnerability in solaris_zone module via crafted
solaris zone
* CVE-2019-14905 Ansible: malicious code could craft filename in
nxos_file_copy module

See:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/v2.9.4/changelogs/CHANGELOG-v2.9.rst
for details on bug fixes in this release.
note.title: Details

described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Abhijeet Kasurde (Red Hat).
